intro: Anneslea crassipes var. obovata, commonly known as the broad-leafed anneslea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Annonaceae family, which includes many tropical species known for their aromatic foliage and showy flowers. The plant features broad, obovate leaves that are often glossy and dark green, providing a striking visual contrast to its white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. The fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release its seeds, contributing to its ecological role in forest regeneration.
